questions.question_text:
You are the Microsoft 365 administrator for a company.
Your company plans to open a new office in the United Kingdom.
You need to provide penetration test and security assessment reports for the new office.
Where can you locate the required reports?

choices.B: Compliance Manager page of the Services Trust portal
choices.C: Data Loss Prevention page of the Security and Compliance portal
choices.A: Data Governance page of the Security and Compliance portal
choices.D: Regional Compliance page of the Services Trust portal

comments.content: Yes, but then by default it’s unselected. So to retain the data you need to make a conscious effort.

The Wipe action restores a device to its factory default settings. The user data is kept if you choose the Retain enrollment state and user account checkbox. Otherwise, all data, apps, and settings will be removed.

comments.content:
Correct. Register a device (MAM - Company Apps) is different than enroll a device (MDM - Company Device)
The 3rd question ask about wipe a personal device, that it's registered (no enrolled). So only the data and apps of the company are deleted.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/user-help/user-help-register-device-on-network

discussion.content:
The Wipe action restores a device to its factory default settings. The user data is kept if you choose the Retain enrollment state and user account checkbox. Otherwise, all data, apps, and settings will be removed.
ref: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/intune/remote-actions/devices-wipe
I thought wiping a device would include personal data. Retiring keeps personal data. Am I missing something?

discussion.content: MFA is for authentication not availability

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/onedrive/developer/rest-api/getting-started/aad-oauth?view=odsp-graph-online

Answer is Azure AD so no

Selected Answer: B
MFA is for second layer authentication for login
ES IST C ;-)

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B. You have the 3 data constructs. Authentication, Availability and Integrity. MFA is down as Authentication (its in the name) not Availability.

Selected Answer: B
I think B

B. Não. A habilitação da autenticação multifator do Microsoft Azure AD é uma prática recomendada para aumentar a segurança das contas de usuário. No entanto, a autenticação multifator por si só não garante a disponibilidade dos dados armazenados no OneDrive for Business para usuários de locais remotos. Ela é uma medida de segurança adicional para proteger o acesso às contas, mas não é diretamente relacionada à disponibilidade dos dados.

Selected Answer: B
Obviously it's B. If you think it's A then maybe you should re-consider this exam
